column4: Is there any other way of upgrading instead of using the GUI way, which is not working since I can't change the mirrors?
sudo apt-get upgrade
thanks, I'll try that!
I'd maybe do sudo apt-get update first
did both, in the order you recommended. I only get "0 aktualisiert, 0 neu installiert, 0 zu entfernen und 0 nicht aktualisiert." -- and nothing after that.
i do not know your language but it sounds like no updates with your mirrors, you can check the mirrorstatus and go from there I imagine.
well, I have changed "old-releases" to "releases", so I guess it might be the issue. I'll change it back and we'll see...
tried again. I have changed the mirrors, updated (update went fine), and then tried upgrading, but got nothing. What else should I check?
past that I got nothing, do you know for a fact there is an update?
well, yes. Update works great. also in aptitude.
what do you mean it works great?

I mean that it has downloaded some stuff, and then summarized -- told me how long did it take, that it is reading the package list, and that it is finished. updating again does not downloading anything again. sounds ok, doesn't it?
yea, sounds like you are updated and nothing is in the pipe.  Ubuntu repos are not exactly bleeding edge.
so what can I do? Why upgrading does not work, without even giving any error message?
I have switched to English. The last line is "0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded."
I think we're maybe understand two different things.  If your system is already up to date then nothing will happen.  As I asked before are you expecting a update?  Something you know is out of date?
I do not expect an update. I expect an UPGRADE. that is, an upgrade of my system to 8.04.
what are you on now?
after doing a slight google it says do an update restart then do another update
ok, I'll try that. thanks.
back to Earth; no change. I get the same results; no upgrade.
sorry man but I dont have anymore answers, this is a big irc channel hope someone else can help.
thanks :)
